path_1.title: Duellists, The (1977)
path_1.feeling: Handsome, measured storytelling with honor-obsessed men kept me engaged more than enthralled.

path_1.title: Descent, The (2005)
path_1.feeling: Claustrophobic thrills and frayed friendships worked on my nerves in a good way.

path_1.title: Lady and the Tramp (1955)
path_1.feeling: Sweet and light on its paws

path_1.title: Peanut Butter Solution, The (1985)
path_1.feeling: Its oddball kid-adventure vibe is endearingly weird and fun.

path_1.title: Kind Hearts and Coronets (1949)
path_1.feeling: Dry wit and meticulous plotting hit a deliciously dark sweet spot.

path_1.title: River's Edge (1986)
path_1.feeling: Bleak, troubling, and compelling in a way that stuck with me.

path_1.title: Beyond the Mat (1999)
path_1.feeling: Behind-the-scenes heartache and grit made the spectacle feel human.

path_1.title: Jezebel (1938)
path_1.feeling: Classic melodrama with bite, well played if a touch formal.

path_1.title: Vampyr (1932)
path_1.feeling: Atmosphere over coherence left me admiring less than enjoying.

path_1.title: Suspicion (1941)
path_1.feeling: Graceful suspense and romantic unease kept me pleasantly taut.

path_1.title: Night of the Living Dead (1968)
path_1.feeling: Tense, scrappy survival drama that still creeps under the skin.

path_1.title: There's No Business Like Show Business (1954)
path_1.feeling: Glossy tunes and family theatrics are lively, if uneven.

path_1.title: Stage Fright (1950)
path_1.feeling: Theatrical twists and backstage tension make for a sturdy thriller.

path_1.title: Grey Fox, The (1982)
path_1.feeling: Gentle, reflective western mood that I warmed to steadily.

path_1.title: Undefeated, The (1969)
path_1.feeling: Serviceable oater with decent scope but not much spark.

path_1.title: Fighting Sullivans, The (Sullivans, The) (1944)
path_1.feeling: Earnest, sentimental, and respectfully stirring without overdoing it.

path_1.title: 8 Women (2002)
path_1.feeling: Frothy intrigue and cattish fun, stylish, witty, and playful.

path_1.title: Proof (2005)
path_1.feeling: Intimate, talky drama with a cool brain and a guarded heart.

path_1.title: It's A Wonderful World (1939)
path_1.feeling: Snappy caper-romance that breezes along with charm.

path_1.title: Harper (1966)
path_1.feeling: Lean, sardonic detective work, my kind of crime comfort.

path_1.title: Running on Empty (1988)
path_1.feeling: Tender and conflicted, it finds real feeling in a fugitive life.

path_1.title: Lady and the Tramp (1955)
path_1.feeling: Still charming

path_1.title: Miss Firecracker (1989)
path_1.feeling: Offbeat Southern sparkle that amuses more than dazzles.

path_1.title: East is East (1999)
path_1.feeling: Warm, sharp culture-clash comedy with real heart.

path_1.title: Up in the Air (2009)
path_1.feeling: Sleek and bittersweet, but it kept me at arm's length.

path_1.title: I'm No Angel (1933)
path_1.feeling: Saucy, breezy fun with a wink that never wears out.

path_5.feeling: Warm, gently witty romance with enduring charm and a few creaky beats.

path_5.title: Peanut Butter Solution, The (1985)
path_5.feeling: Oddball childhood fantasy whose off-kilter magic and 80s vibe tickled me.

path_5.title: Kind Hearts and Coronets (1949)
path_5.feeling: Wickedly dry, immaculately shaped murder farce that delights in its precision.

path_5.title: River's Edge (1986)
path_5.feeling: Cold, unsettling teen nihilism with a moral chill that lingers.

path_5.title: Beyond the Mat (1999)
path_5.feeling: Candid, compassionate look behind the rope—human costs laid bare.

path_5.title: Jezebel (1938)
path_5.feeling: Plush southern melodrama carried by willful fire and classic studio sheen.

path_5.title: Vampyr (1932)
path_5.feeling: Dreamlike textures admired, but the trance left me at a distance.

path_5.title: Suspicion (1941)
path_5.feeling: Silky, teasing Hitchcock with elegant unease and star wattage.

path_5.title: Night of the Living Dead (1968)
path_5.feeling: Lean, grim siege piece—effective and bracing more than terrifying.

path_5.title: There's No Business Like Show Business (1954)
path_5.feeling: Glossy songbook pageant—corny in parts, buoyant in spirit.

path_5.title: Stage Fright (1950)
path_5.feeling: Well-turned backstage suspense with sly turns and steady craft.

path_5.title: Grey Fox, The (1982)
path_5.feeling: Gentle, late-bloom outlaw tale with weathered grace and quiet melancholy.

path_5.title: Undefeated, The (1969)
path_5.feeling: Amiable, lumbering postwar western whose broad charm outweighs its creaks.

path_5.title: Fighting Sullivans, The (Sullivans, The) (1944)
path_5.feeling: Sincere wartime tribute—earnest and moving if firmly old-fashioned.

path_5.title: 8 Women (2002)
path_5.feeling: Candy-colored whodunit lark—arch, playful, and tartly performed.

path_5.title: Proof (2005)
path_5.feeling: Intimate father-daughter tangle—thoughtful, polished, a bit stage-bound.

path_5.title: It's A Wonderful World (1939)
path_5.feeling: Spry screwball caper with pleasing banter and breezy momentum.

path_5.title: Harper (1966)
path_5.feeling: Cool, cynical detective ride with jazzy snap and solid grit.

path_5.title: Running on Empty (1988)
path_5.feeling: Tender, morally knotted family drama that quietly got to me.

path_5.title: Lady and the Tramp (1955)
path_5.feeling: Warm, gently witty romance with enduring charm and a few creaky beats.

path_5.title: Miss Firecracker (1989)
path_5.feeling: Sweet, small-town pageant tale—earnest spark with modest payoff.

path_5.title: East is East (1999)
path_5.feeling: Vivid, funny-sad culture clash with big heart and sharp edges.

path_5.title: Up in the Air (2009)
path_5.feeling: Sleek, bittersweet modern drift—smartly packaged, lightly affecting.

path_5.title: I'm No Angel (1933)
path_5.feeling: Saucy pre-Code charms and punchy quips delivered with breezy verve.
